Lanceboard_AD.synopsis: ADs for Mol and Raphael as they play lanceboard. Mol is pretending to be unskilled and disinterested in the game.
Lanceboard_AD.how_to_trigger: Observe Mol and Raphael as they play lanceboard.

AD_MonitorLeave.synopsis: AD spoken by Raphael as he stands to leave after playing chess with Mol.

MolMoving.synopsis: Back up line after Mol has vouched for the player and is running back to last light in to play a game of lanceboard with raphael.
MolMoving.how_to_trigger: Talk to Mol before she gets into position at the lanceboard game with raphael.loadlevel SCL_Main_Aoe debugbook > act 2 set up > teifling pathgo to region > act 2 > haven > bridgego through checkpoint dialogright after: teleportToMe S_DEN_ThiefHideoutLeader

Raphael.synopsis: If Mol is dead or not present for other reasons, this solo dialogue for Raphael will take place instead.Rather than sitting at the lanceboard table, he is looming in the corner observing everyone else in Last Light.

AD_NoticedStolenBoard.synopsis: Mol reacts to the player having stolen and put the lanceboard elsewhere.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay.synopsis: The player comes across Mol and Raphael playing a game of lanceboard (Forgotten Realms chess). The devil is clearly beating Mol, but with the player's help, she can win.Cinematic Notes: Mol and Raphael are sitting down throughout this entire scene. Raphael teleports out of his seat at the end and is no longer on screen.
Lanceboard_ThreeWay.how_to_trigger: Walk up to Mol and Raphael in the Tavern.

Mol.synopsis: After the lanceboard game (HAV_MolsDeal_Lanceboard_ThreeWay.lsj), Mol will slink off away from Raphael and can be spoken to alone to discuss his deal. This dialogue can happen as long as the inn has not been attacked yet.After the game with Raphael, Mol can be found in a corner by a dusty shelf, where she's shoved the lanceboard. She clearly stole a piece from the set, fiddling with it as the player approaches.
Mol.how_to_trigger: - Load SCL_Main_A- Talk to Mol and Raphael at the lanceboard (-61, 132)- Find Mol at the bar (-72, 143)- Click to talk to her

automatic_ordering.reasoning: Based on the session descriptions, several ordering relationships and mutually exclusive events can be inferred. First, the ‘MolMoving’ dialogue is prompted when Mol has vouched for the player and must be triggered before Mol takes her position at the lanceboard game. This game is represented by the 'Lanceboard_ThreeWay' session. After the game, Mol exits to be spoken to alone – shown as the 'Mol' session – and her later reaction to a stolen lanceboard leads to the 'AD_NoticedStolenBoard' session. In addition, there is a dialogue 'AD_MonitorLeave' triggered when Raphael stands to leave after playing chess with Mol, suggesting that his leaving follows the lanceboard game. Furthermore, if Mol happens to be dead or simply not present, then the solo 'Raphael' session occurs instead of the cooperative game and post-game Mol dialogues. Hence, sessions that involve Mol (such as 'Lanceboard_ThreeWay', 'Mol', and by implication 'MolMoving') are mutually exclusive with the 'Raphael' solo dialogue session. The 'RaphaelWaiting' session does not have enough details to be placed in any order so it is omitted from ordering constraints.

Lanceboard_AD_1.speaker: Mol
Lanceboard_AD_1.text: This game's awful. Why's anyone play it?
Lanceboard_AD_1.context: NodeContext: pretending to be bad at the game (she's actually amazing at it)

Lanceboard_AD_5.speaker: Raphael
Lanceboard_AD_5.text: It hones a strategic mind, my dear. Take your turn.

Lanceboard_AD_6.speaker: Mol
Lanceboard_AD_6.context: NodeContext: pretending to be bad at the game (she's actually amazing at it)

Lanceboard_AD_2.speaker: Mol
Lanceboard_AD_2.text: Should have picked your pockets instead of doin' this.
Lanceboard_AD_2.context: NodeContext: pretending to be bad at the game (she's actually amazing at it)

Lanceboard_AD_4.speaker: Raphael
Lanceboard_AD_4.context: NodeContext: Tight smile, amused that a child is threatening to pickpocket him

Lanceboard_AD_0.speaker: Mol
Lanceboard_AD_0.text: Oh? You must be broke, then.
Lanceboard_AD_0.context: NodeContext: teasing raphael, a devil (would not recommend, but mol is BRAZEN)

Lanceboard_AD_3.speaker: Mol
Lanceboard_AD_3.text: How much are these pieces worth?
Lanceboard_AD_3.context: NodeContext: discussing the lanceboard pieces in front of her

Lanceboard_AD_8.speaker: Raphael
Lanceboard_AD_8.text: The value is in the player, not in the pieces.
Lanceboard_AD_8.context: NodeContext: being his cryptic mysterious self

Lanceboard_AD_7.speaker: Mol
Lanceboard_AD_7.text: Don't you ever give a straight answer?
Lanceboard_AD_7.context: NodeContext: raphael keeps dodging her questions, annoyed

AD_MonitorLeave_0.speaker: Raphael
AD_MonitorLeave_0.text: If you'll excuse me, I must see to urgent matters.

AD_MonitorLeave_1.speaker: Raphael
AD_MonitorLeave_1.text: But don't you fret. I shall always find time for my most treasured acquaintance.

MolMoving_0.speaker: Mol
MolMoving_0.text: Look, you're welcome and all, but I've gotta chat with bigger fish. Later.
MolMoving_0.context: NodeContext: clearly in a rush and needs to go

Raphael_20.speaker: Raphael
Raphael_20.text: My, my, fancy meeting you here! Little late to be traipsing around Last Light, isn't it? You've lit the fire, you've freed the angel,  so shoo! Go after her!

Raphael_36.speaker: Player
Raphael_36.text: I wanted to ask you about the Infernal scars on my back. What do they mean?

Raphael_25.speaker: Raphael
Raphael_25.text: Don't worry - I'm motivated to help you. Scars often tell such wonderful stories - I think yours might be truly exquisite. I'll see you soon.

Raphael_33.speaker: Player
Raphael_33.text: I need a shot of liquid courage before I go. Perhaps you'll join me.

Raphael_60.speaker: Raphael
Raphael_60.text: Too parochial a setting for me, I'm afraid. I prefer my liquor served in a quivering belly button, distilled in fear and arousal.

Raphael_37.speaker: Raphael
Raphael_37.text: Anyway - don't linger here too long, will you? I've got front row tickets for your grand finale in Moonrise Towers, and I'm dying to see the show go on.

Raphael_48.speaker: Player
Raphael_48.text: A devil encouraging me to follow an angel. Aren't you full of surprises.

Raphael_66.speaker: Raphael
Raphael_66.text: Sometimes you've got to root for Team Celestial. Keeps you on your toes.

Raphael_9.speaker: Player
Raphael_9.text: You really have a knack for showing up in all the wrong places.

Raphael_69.speaker: Raphael
Raphael_69.text: You've got a knack for giving me the dullest reply you could have possibly given.

Raphael_55.speaker: Raphael
Raphael_55.text: It's good to see you again. I'd ask if you've made any progress with your little problem, but the tell-tale twitching of your eye is answer enough.
Raphael_55.context: CinematicNodeContext: Raphael turns to the player and smiles.

Raphael_51.speaker: Player
Raphael_51.text: You again - I'm sure your arrival is simply a coincidence.

Raphael_2.speaker: Raphael
Raphael_2.text: My dear, nothing is coincidence. Mortals trifle themselves with free will, as if their betters have not moulded every potential path ahead.

Raphael_62.speaker: Raphael
Raphael_62.text: No offence meant, of course. I'm sure everyone in Last Light thinks they could have changed things.

Raphael_27.context: CinematicNodeContext: Raphael leans in, pressing in on the player's personal space.

Raphael_83.speaker: Raphael
Raphael_83.text: They're not the only ones ripe for temptation, you know. My last contract here fed me for decades.

Raphael_24.speaker: Player
Raphael_24.text: I wanted to ask you about the Infernal scars on my back. What do they mean?

Raphael_58.speaker: Raphael
Raphael_58.text: But of course, those curious little marks. Something important to your master, no doubt, but what?

Raphael_43.speaker: Raphael
Raphael_43.text: A love letter? A warning? A deed of ownership? I could give you all the gory details.

Raphael_89.speaker: Raphael
Raphael_89.text: But of course, you'll have to do something for me first. Let me think about it and get back to you.

Raphael_23.speaker: Raphael
Raphael_23.text: I do love the people I meet in these dark lands. Everyone's desperate for something.

Raphael_75.speaker: Raphael
Raphael_75.text: Family troubles. Not my family, of course.

Raphael_41.speaker: Player
Raphael_41.text: You're not responsible for the curse, are you?

Raphael_64.speaker: Raphael
Raphael_64.text: Please, I would never leave such a mess behind. Far too much attention for so little gain.

Raphael_21.speaker: Raphael
Raphael_21.text: At times I wonder if some other fiend swapped out your tongue with that of an ox.

Raphael_8.speaker: Raphael
Raphael_8.text: I never surrender knowledge for free, but one good turn deserves another, does it not? To repay you for the souls sent my way, I offer a taste of the truth.

Raphael_17.speaker: Raphael
Raphael_17.text: Ketheric Thorm - proud father, man of faith, utter fool. On the night the Harpers sealed him away, someone murdered his entire army in cold blood.

Raphael_4.speaker: Raphael
Raphael_4.text: Now who would possibly benefit from such a massacre?

Raphael_44.speaker: Raphael
Raphael_44.text: If you want to know more, I could work the exchange of such precious knowledge into the terms of your future deal.

Raphael_82.speaker: Raphael
Raphael_82.text: But the time for quibbling over clauses and contracts hasn't quite arrived. You'll be limping back to me soon enough.

Raphael_46.speaker: Raphael
Raphael_46.text: Not with you, at least. Although I sense there's something your friend wants to ask me.

Raphael_12.speaker: Astarion
Raphael_12.text: I do. I have a proposal for you.

Raphael_42.speaker: Raphael
Raphael_42.text: A proposal? If you're hoping to taste my blood, little vampling, think again. It burns hotter than Wyvern Whiskey.

Raphael_0.speaker: Astarion
Raphael_0.text: My old - well, a long time ago someone carved infernal runes into my back. They are a fragment of a contract. I'd like to know what the full contract says.

Raphael_86.speaker: Player
Raphael_86.text: What are you talking about, Astarion? What scars?

Raphael_19.speaker: Raphael
Raphael_19.text: You haven't told them? And you've kept your clothes on this whole time? How unlike you.

Raphael_54.speaker: Raphael
Raphael_54.text: Why not let them see? Don't be shy.
Raphael_54.context: CinematicNodeContext: Raphael waves his hand and Astarion's shirt magically disappears.

Raphael_56.speaker: Astarion
Raphael_56.context: NodeContext: Fed up with this shit (a devil just magicked away your shirt.)

Raphael_61.speaker: Raphael
Raphael_61.text: Don't worry - I'm motivated to help you. Scars often tell such wonderful stories - I think yours might be truly exquisite. I'll see you soon.

Raphael_88.speaker: Player
Raphael_88.text: Why didn't you tell me earlier? I could have helped.

Raphael_3.speaker: Astarion
Raphael_3.text: I - perhaps I should have. I'm not exactly used to asking for help and being met with, well... help.

Raphael_16.speaker: Astarion
Raphael_16.text: But what's done is done, so how about we stop talking about it and just get on with things?

Raphael_74.speaker: Astarion
Raphael_74.text: Although I should probably get dressed first...

Raphael_32.speaker: Player
Raphael_32.text: Gods... the carving must have been excruciating.

Raphael_28.speaker: Astarion
Raphael_28.text: Cazador worked on it from dusk until dawn, all with an ancient blade he called his 'needle'. Cutting and tearing, starting over if I screamed or winced too much.

Raphael_78.speaker: Player
Raphael_78.text: All I know is you have us doing odd jobs for a devil.

Raphael_90.speaker: Astarion
Raphael_90.text: It could be infinitely worse. We seem to be rather good at killing things.

Raphael_79.speaker: Astarion
Raphael_79.text: Let's just go. Standing here chatting gets us nowhere.

Raphael_38.speaker: Player
Raphael_38.text: Don't play games Raphael. Help him out.

Raphael_91.speaker: Raphael
Raphael_91.text: It's something very important to your master. But is it a love letter, a warning, or a deed of ownership? I could give you all the gory details.

Raphael_11.speaker: Raphael
Raphael_11.text: But of course, you'll have to do something for me first. Let me think about it and get back to you.

Raphael_39.speaker: Astarion
Raphael_39.text: You'll 'get back' to me? This is important, devil. When?

Raphael_34.speaker: Raphael
Raphael_34.text: Don't worry - I'm motivated to help you. Scars often tell such wonderful stories - I think yours might be truly exquisite. I'll see you soon.

Raphael_59.speaker: Player
Raphael_59.text: This is a bad idea Astarion. We should find another way.

Raphael_18.speaker: Astarion
Raphael_18.text: My old - well, a long time ago someone carved some runes into my back. I'd rather like to know what they say.
Raphael_18.context: NodeContext: Starts saying 'my old master...' but stops himself

Raphael_49.speaker: Raphael
Raphael_49.text: With your tail between your legs.

Raphael_5.speaker: Raphael
Raphael_5.text: For now, I'm afraid you've already made me late for a meeting with another client. I'll see you soon.

Raphael_67.context: CinematicNodeContext: Raphael disappears from the room, leaving behind nothing but a bare wall.

Raphael_29.speaker: Raphael
Raphael_29.text: You flatter yourself - you're not the only soul of interest in this ruin. This is Last Light, where hope hangs on by a single withered thread.

Raphael_57.speaker: Player
Raphael_57.text: I'm fine - the last thing I need is your meddling.

Raphael_87.speaker: Player
Raphael_87.text: Wipe that smugness from your face or I'll smite it off.

Raphael_72.speaker: Raphael
Raphael_72.text: You're the best thing for business since the Second Sundering. Countless sorry souls came running to my door after your work in the grove.
Raphael_72.context: CinematicNodeContext: Raphael turns to the player and smiles.

Raphael_80.speaker: Player
Raphael_80.text: I'd have sent more souls your way, but I ran out of tieflings to kill.

Raphael_15.speaker: Raphael
Raphael_15.text: Such a shame to end a spree before you've tired of the slaughter. But don't be disheartened.

Raphael_77.speaker: Raphael
Raphael_77.text: After all - here you are again, in a refuge for the haggard and weary. Plenty of clients - or victims - for both of us.

Raphael_30.speaker: Player
Raphael_30.text: Enjoy them while you can - I'll smite you down soon enough.

Raphael_10.speaker: Raphael
Raphael_10.text: You wound me. I've only tried to be a friend to you - just as to the poor souls here, where hope hangs by a single thread.

Raphael_73.speaker: Raphael
Raphael_73.text: I can mend it or cut it, depending on what they ask for.

RaphaelWaiting_0.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelWaiting_0.text: Sorry, I have an appointment with someone far more interesting than you. We'll speak soon.

AD_NoticedStolenBoard_0.speaker: Mol
AD_NoticedStolenBoard_0.text: Huh. Just put this away a second ago... didn't I?

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_7.speaker: Raphael
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_7.context: CinematicNodeContext: Raphael watches in cold amusement as Mol grips one of the pieces, clearly anxious.NodeContext: Says the cat to the mouse

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_49.speaker: Mol
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_49.text: You trapped me. I didn't even want to take this one.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_199.speaker: Raphael
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_199.text: Calimshan rules, dear. The first piece touched is the first piece moved.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_82.speaker: Mol
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_82.text: That's garbage. No matter where the knight goes, I'm gonna lose it.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_179.speaker: Raphael
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_179.text: Then make the sacrifice useful. Guard your Mystra, or come for my Cyric.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_198.speaker: Karlach
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_198.context: NodeContext: Suspicious, happening upon Raphael and Mol (tween crime lord) playing chess together.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_110.speaker: Mol
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_110.text: Oh, hey. I remember you. Booked it from the grove before the druids could kick us.
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_110.context: NodeContext: Not particularly happy to see the player.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_201.speaker: Mol
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_201.text: Smart. You smart enough for lanceboard? It's my first time playing.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_96.speaker: Mol
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_96.text: Hey! What's a big hero like you doing in a dustheap like this?
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_96.context: CinematicNodeContext: <pre> Mol's face goes intense with concentration. She notices being watched by the player, and smiles, surprised.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_61.speaker: Mol
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_61.text: Look who made it! For once I saved your butt out there, didn't I? We're square now, chief.
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_61.context: CinematicNodeContext: <pre> Mol's face goes intense with concentration. She notices being watched by the player, and smiles, surprised.NodeContext: Mischievous and pleased with herself.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_83.speaker: Mol
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_83.text: Say, do you play lanceboard by any chance? It's my first time playing.
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_83.context: NodeContext: Dropping her voice, a little soft and conspiratorial.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_31.speaker: Narrator
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_31.text: *The keen gleam in Mol's eyes reveals the lie. She knows the game well, and she wants to win.*

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_108.speaker: Gale
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_108.text: He's laid a fine trap for you, Mol. But it looks to me like his Cyric could be dethroned.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_89.speaker: Player
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_89.text: Gale's right. Put pressure on him. Attack the pieces in front of his Cyric.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_206.speaker: Player
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_206.text: Fall back. Protect your queen above everything else.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_173.speaker: Gale
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_173.text: That's... certainly another strategy. A losing one, but a strategy nonetheless.
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_173.context: NodeContext: Thinks you made a bad decision. Knows what's coming - Mol is about to lose. He may or may not have suggested you take a specific alternative strategy.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_93.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mol moves the piece back. Raphael raises a brow in disapproval

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_100.speaker: Raphael
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_100.text: You should be more careful who you listen to. Retreat begets regret. Always.
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_100.context: NodeContext: Happy the player made Mol choose the wrong move. Arrogantly superior.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_209.speaker: Player
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_209.text: You shouldn't be playing games with this man. He's a devil.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_27.speaker: Mol
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_27.text: Sure, and I'm Zariel's firstborn. Don't be distractin' me.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_53.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mol hastily moves the piece in her hand to another square.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_33.speaker: Player
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_33.text: Put pressure on him. Attack the pieces in front of his king.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_169.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mol nods, moving her piece forward and snagging one of Raphael's pawns.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_37.speaker: Raphael
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_37.text: My, the Theskan Double Counter-Gambit. Vicious. Exactly what I would have done.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_149.speaker: Player
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_149.text: Sorry, kid. I've never played lanceboard.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_52.speaker: Mol
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_52.text: Pfft. Guess no one's good at everything.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_124.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player knocks the board a bit obviously. When the pieces fall, Raphael's eyes narrow.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_188.speaker: Raphael
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_188.text: Oh dear, aren't we clumsy? Let me put these back in place.
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_188.context: CinematicNodeContext: Raphael sets the pieces back in place.NodeContext: It's obvious he realises the player tried to cheat on behalf of Mol.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_220.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mol and Raphael exchange pieces, ending the game as he captures her king.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_160.speaker: Mol
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_160.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mol's face collapses in disappointment.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_139.speaker: Raphael
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_139.context: NodeContext: smug, but with a threatening undertone

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_101.speaker: Raphael
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_101.text: You came close, though. All you needed was a dash more courage.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_168.speaker: Raphael
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_168.text: You will remember that, won't you, when you consider my offer?

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_73.speaker: Player
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_73.text: Rig the game with some sleight of hand.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_36.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player jostles the board, knocking several pieces over. When Raphael's eyes flicker to the player, Mol quickly sets the pieces back up - with a change or two.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_40.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mol and Raphael exchange pieces, ending the game when she knocks his king over.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_151.speaker: Raphael
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_151.text: Brava! Lovely work. I see I was right to make you the offer I did.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_94.speaker: Raphael
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_94.text: You will consider it, won't you?

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_74.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mol nods, then folds the pieces into the landboard to put them away, disappearing out of view. When Raphael is centered on screen again, he is standing and smiling at the player.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_141.speaker: Raphael
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_141.text: What a lovely specimen she is. A blushing apple, begging to be plucked.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_22.speaker: Karlach
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_22.text: Please let me smack this creep.
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_22.context: NodeContext: Raphael called Mol a 'blushing apple' and Karlach is not amused at all. Through gritted teeth, to the player (Raphael won't respond to this)

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_46.speaker: Raphael
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_46.text: She might have won, you know - if you hadn't made her retreat.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_25.speaker: Raphael
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_25.text: Indeed. There's no telling where life will lead us - into the Hells, out of them again...

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_84.speaker: Player
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_84.text: It's in her best interest to retreat from a devil.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_152.speaker: Raphael
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_152.text: Look outside. There's no one else for her to run to.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_180.speaker: Player
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_180.text: Is that why you're here? To play games?

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_161.speaker: Raphael
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_161.text: To play the game. The vast lanceboard of souls.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_205.speaker: Player
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_205.text: Just bugger off back to Hell, would you?

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_138.speaker: Raphael
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_138.text: Hell is wherever I take it. I just call it Hope, remember?

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_150.speaker: Raphael
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_150.text: Her victory was hollow, of course. Frankly, I expected better of you - did Mol ask to have your god win the game for her?

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_38.speaker: Player
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_38.text: A god is quite handy when dealing with devils.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_91.speaker: Raphael
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_91.text: Oh, I promise on every treasure I own... you've never dealt with a devil like me before.
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_91.context: CinematicNodeContext: he leans in with a wicked, knowing grinNodeContext: with a wicked, knowing grin

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_207.speaker: Raphael
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_207.text: I noticed your little trick, by the way. You should trust Mol - she never asked for your god to interfere in the game.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_154.speaker: Player
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_154.text: I'll not take lessons on morality from a devil, thanks.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_19.speaker: Raphael
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_19.text: Morality? No. The lesson is rather more about autonomy - not some you zealous types know much of.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_131.speaker: Raphael
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_131.text: She might have won, you know - if you hadn't been so hell-bent on exposing my truer nature.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_148.speaker: Player
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_148.text: Someone's gotta look out for her.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_197.speaker: Raphael
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_197.text: A pity no one did the same for you, all those years ago.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_103.speaker: Player
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_103.text: She has a right to know your truer nature.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_59.speaker: Raphael
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_59.text: She'd never take your word for it - not with my angelic complexion.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_118.speaker: Raphael
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_118.text: She might have won, you know. There was no need for your attempt at sabotage.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_102.speaker: Raphael
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_102.text: I'm afraid you'll find me more difficult to ruffle than that.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_44.speaker: Player
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_44.text: I had a feeling the odds weren't in her favour.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_134.speaker: Raphael
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_134.text: She cheated, of course, but that's half her charm.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_212.speaker: Player
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_212.text: Leave her alone. I'm warning you.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_32.speaker: Raphael
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_32.text: Oh please, Karlach. Let us abandon this cack-handed attempt at solving your problems by fixing hers.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_0.speaker: Player
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_0.text: And what is the other half?

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_66.speaker: Raphael
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_66.text: The Theskan move suggestion was inspired. I had no idea you played.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_174.speaker: Player
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_174.text: Beating devils brings out the best in me.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_87.speaker: Player
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_87.text: There's plenty about me you have no idea about.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_158.speaker: Player
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_158.text: A list of my many hidden talents would stretch to Avernus and back.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_143.speaker: Raphael
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_143.text: I can most certainly believe it.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_54.speaker: Raphael
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_54.text: She might have won, you know - with a little push in the right direction.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_163.speaker: Player
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_163.text: I figured the girl could handle herself.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_9.speaker: Raphael
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_9.text: Just like yourself - isn't that right?

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_204.speaker: Raphael
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_204.text: But don't you worry about Mol - it goes without saying she still has the unconditional freedom to choose the only option she has left.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_113.speaker: Raphael
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_113.text: Now, let's talk about you. I sense there's something you want to ask me.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_104.speaker: Astarion
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_104.text: I do. I have a proposal for you.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_24.speaker: Raphael
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_24.text: A proposal? If you're hoping to taste my blood, little vampling, think again. It burns hotter than Wyvern Whiskey.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_81.speaker: Astarion
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_81.text: My old - well, a long time ago, someone carved infernal runes into my back. They are a fragment of a contract. I'd like to know what the full contract says.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_63.speaker: Astarion
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_63.text: My old - well, a long time ago, someone carved some runes into my back. I'd rather like to know what they say.
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_63.context: NodeContext: Starts saying 'my old master...' but stops himself

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_13.speaker: Player
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_13.text: What are you talking about, Astarion? What scars?

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_5.speaker: Raphael
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_5.text: You haven't told them? And you've kept your clothes on this whole time? How unlike you.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_123.speaker: Raphael
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_123.text: Why not let them see? Don't be shy.
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_123.context: CinematicNodeContext: Raphael waves his hand and Astarion's shirt magically disappears.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_153.speaker: Astarion
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_153.context: NodeContext: Fed up with this shit (a devil just magicked away your shirt.)

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_146.speaker: Raphael
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_146.text: Don't worry - I'm motivated to help you. Scars often tell such wonderful stories - I think yours might be truly exquisite. I'll see you soon.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_129.speaker: Player
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_129.text: Why didn't you tell me earlier? I could have helped.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_107.speaker: Astarion
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_107.text: I - perhaps I should have. I'm not exactly used to asking for help and being met with, well... help.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_202.speaker: Astarion
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_202.text: But what's done is done, so how about we stop talking about it and just get on with things?

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_191.speaker: Astarion
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_191.text: Although I should probably get dressed first...

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_130.speaker: Player
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_130.text: Gods... the carving must have been excruciating.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_176.speaker: Astarion
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_176.text: Cazador worked on it from dusk until dawn, all with an ancient blade he called his 'needle'. Cutting and tearing, starting over if I screamed or winced too much.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_133.speaker: Player
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_133.text: All I know is you have us doing odd jobs for a devil.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_214.speaker: Astarion
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_214.text: It could be infinitely worse. We seem to be rather good at killing things.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_223.speaker: Astarion
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_223.text: Let's just go. Standing here chatting gets us nowhere.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_218.speaker: Player
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_218.text: Don't play games, Raphael. Help him out.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_26.speaker: Player
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_26.text: This is a bad idea, Astarion. We should find another way.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_159.speaker: Raphael
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_159.text: It's something very important to your master. But is it a love letter, a warning, or a deed of ownership? I could give you all the gory details.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_2.speaker: Raphael
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_2.text: But of course, you'll have to do something for me first. Let me think about it and get back to you.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_145.speaker: Astarion
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_145.text: You'll 'get back' to me? This is important, devil. When?

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_210.speaker: Raphael
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_210.text: Don't worry - I'm motivated to help you. Scars often tell such wonderful stories - I think yours might be truly exquisite. I'll see you soon.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_30.speaker: Raphael
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_30.text: Besides, I do enjoy being in this neighbourhood again. It has such a rich history of abject tragedy.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_170.speaker: Raphael
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_170.text: And tragedy, my friend, well there's my bread and bloody butter.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_178.speaker: Player
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_178.text: Speaking of bloody - the scars on my back. Can you tell me what they mean?

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_119.speaker: Player
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_119.text: So what is this region's history of tragedy?

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_14.speaker: Raphael
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_14.text: Why spoil it? It's all out there, waiting to be discovered.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_72.speaker: Raphael
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_72.text: You never know what you might find if you just... dig a little deeper.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_20.speaker: Player
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_20.text: Just stay away from Mol, you hear?

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_115.speaker: Raphael
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_115.text: She won. She has a taste for it now. She'll be the one who comes to me.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_55.speaker: Raphael
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_55.text: But enough about my lesser pursuits. Why bother with trifles when I'm in the illustrious presence of my very favourite client!

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_166.speaker: Raphael
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_166.text: Tell me, O apple of my eye, how have you been? You don't have any gills to get green around yet, but you do look a bit worse for wear in this light.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_164.speaker: Player
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_164.text: I want to know about the scars on my back. What do they mean?

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_183.speaker: Raphael
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_183.text: But of course, those curious little marks. Something important to your master, no doubt, but what?

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_6.speaker: Raphael
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_6.text: A love letter? A warning? A deed of ownership? I could give you all the gory details.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_111.speaker: Raphael
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_111.text: But of course, you'll have to do something for me first. Let me think about it and get back to you.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_51.speaker: Raphael
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_51.text: Don't worry - I'm motivated to help you. Scars often tell such wonderful stories - I think yours might be truly exquisite. I'll see you soon.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_211.speaker: Player
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_211.text: Might be the infernal engine in my chest.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_34.speaker: Raphael
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_34.text: Poor Karlach. She really suffers so terribly, death haranguing her from every angle. But it hasn't struck yet, has it?

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_35.speaker: Raphael
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_35.text: In fact, I'm quite confident you still have a few good days in you yet. Precious time to practise begging for my help with your bare knees in the dirt.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_116.speaker: Raphael
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_116.text: I really am at my magnanimous best when people make an effort.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_222.speaker: Player
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_222.text: If you're still offering solutions, I'm all ears.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_42.speaker: Raphael
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_42.text: All thumbs, rather, the way you've been stumbling about the place. But at least I can't say I'm not entertained.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_217.speaker: Player
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_217.text: You know, I've never been better.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_125.speaker: Raphael
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_125.text: I have this picture in my head - of you tossing and turning in the middle of the night, thinking strange things, dreaming strange dreams.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_4.speaker: Raphael
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_4.text: And there's this little voice inside of you asking: 'Is this my will, or is it the worm's?' But you have no answer, and no way of knowing.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_3.speaker: Raphael
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_3.text: The good thing is, though, there's only one little voice you really should listen to.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_155.speaker: Raphael
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_155.text: She lost. She is lost. It's only a matter of time before the apple is plucked.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_109.speaker: Player
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_109.text: I can't resist a good tragedy. Indulge me - what happened here?

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_136.speaker: Raphael
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_136.text: Come now, you'd have me tell you? Spoil all the fun?

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_16.speaker: Raphael
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_16.text: Suffice to say there's ambition, folly, and death aplenty. The rest... well. I'll let you uncover that yourself.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_15.context: CinematicNodeContext: Raphael disappears, leaving behind nothing but an empty table.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_62.speaker: Player
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_62.text: A little push away from you is exactly the right direction.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_144.speaker: Player
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_144.text: Calimshan fell because its nobility got cocky. Put pressure on his king.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_47.speaker: Player
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_47.text: Why would I play a game that imitates war when I can fight any time I want?

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_219.speaker: Player
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_219.text: This is a game that tests your mind. Look at the board with fresh eyes - what does your opponent hide?

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_99.speaker: Mol
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_99.text: Hmm. A-ha - his king is wide open!
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_99.context: NodeContext: Looking down, considering - suddenly victorious

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_18.speaker: Player
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_18.text: Of course I play. No better way to learn battle strategy than lanceboard. It's fun, too.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_90.speaker: Mol
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_90.text: Didn't ask for your life story - I asked if you could play. What's the next move?

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_71.speaker: Player
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_71.text: You win by taking the king - attack it at all costs. The Vanquisher's Lance stratagem.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_122.speaker: Player
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_122.text: He's set up a clever little trap. But... his Cyric looks rather open, don't you think?

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_105.speaker: Gale
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_105.text: Exactly what I was about to suggest.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_185.speaker: Player
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_185.text: Say you don't want to interfere and pray for your god to guide Mol's hand.

Lanceboard_ThreeWay_177.speaker: Gale
Lanceboard_ThreeWay_177.text: I see that glint in your eyes. You've a strategy in mind. The same one as me, I'd wager.

Mol_82.speaker: Mol
Mol_82.text: Wonder if I could con some gold off that cleric.

Mol_99.speaker: Mol
Mol_99.text: Should've trusted my gut instead of asking for help.
Mol_99.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mol is fiddling with a piece of the lanceboard set. She pockets it behind her back before talking to the player.NodeContext: Disappointed.

Mol_101.speaker: Mol
Mol_101.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mol is fiddling with a piece of the lanceboard set. She pockets it behind her back before talking to the player, smilingNodeContext: Very pleased.

Mol_105.speaker: Mol
Mol_105.text: If we put our heads together, I bet you and me could make a tidy stack of coin in Baldur's Gate.

Mol_112.speaker: Mol
Mol_112.text: But Raphael's offered me a partnership already, and it seems like a sweeter deal than throwing my lot in with you.

Mol_88.speaker: Karlach
Mol_88.context: NodeContext: Subtext is thinking about herself. She's advising a kid not to deal with a devil. It's a quiet convo so not to dramatic, but very sincere on Karlach's part.

Mol_87.speaker: Player
Mol_87.text: Make a deal with a devil, little one. Once you fall, you'll never look back.

Mol_76.speaker: Mol
Mol_76.text: Hey! I'm not so little! Grown-up enough to have grown up ages ago.

Mol_52.speaker: Player
Mol_52.text: Though it can be near-impossible to stay on the good path, you have to try. We all have to try.

Mol_116.speaker: Player
Mol_116.text: You need to stay away from Raphael. His deals are poison.

Mol_13.speaker: Player
Mol_13.text: Like a prick from a scorpion, Raphael's deals seem innocuous, but they are poison.

Mol_5.speaker: Mol
Mol_5.text: You must love the taste of it. He seems to know you pretty well.

Mol_57.speaker: Player
Mol_57.text: I know him well enough to know he's a trickster.

Mol_47.speaker: Mol
Mol_47.text: Whatever. I'm tired of taking orders from people who think they know better than me.

Mol_59.speaker: Mol
Mol_59.text: Do as I say, not as I do, right? Got a lot of that from Zev too, and he was a walking pile of imp shite at the end of the day.

Mol_74.speaker: Player
Mol_74.text: I haven't made any kind of deal with him. He's just trying to tempt me.

Mol_50.speaker: Player
Mol_50.text: My problems are more urgent than yours - I have to deal with him.

Mol_22.speaker: Player
Mol_22.text: What exactly did he offer you?

Mol_32.speaker: Mol
Mol_32.text: Protection for me and my kids. That's all.

Mol_37.speaker: Narrator
Mol_37.text: *Her smile is broad, her eyes twinkling, her face the very picture of innocence. She's clearly lying.*

Mol_31.speaker: Mol
Mol_31.text: But I haven't accepted nothing yet. Sounds like you're in deeper than I am.

Mol_75.speaker: Player
Mol_75.text: Raphael's dangerous, Mol. What did he really offer you?

Mol_27.speaker: Mol
Mol_27.text: What I said! That he'd get me and my gang safely to Baldur's Gate.

Mol_19.speaker: Mol
Mol_19.text: And also... when we get there, I'd be head of the Thieves' Guild.

Mol_15.speaker: Player
Mol_15.text: Trust me, it might sound good but it's not worth it.

Mol_117.speaker: Mol
Mol_117.text: Easy for you to say - you can do what you want, go where you want. My kids need protecting, and I'm going to protect 'em.

Mol_56.speaker: Player
Mol_56.text: And what happens to the current head of the Guild?

Mol_71.speaker: Mol
Mol_71.text: I dunno, devil stuff? What matters is I can keep my kids safe. Everyone else's let them down, but I won't.

Mol_63.speaker: Mol
Mol_63.text: I had the grove running pretty smooth, I'll do the same in Baldur's Gate. And I can keep the kids safe.

Mol_97.speaker: Mol
Mol_97.text: Everyone they turned to let my kids down - the druids, Zevlor, everyone. Now it's my job to keep 'em safe, and I'm gonna do it right.

Mol_90.speaker: Player
Mol_90.text: I haven't made a deal. He's just trying to tempt me.

Mol_8.speaker: Mol
Mol_8.text: Looked like he was doin' a pretty good job. If I had to deal with gods and worms in my head, I'd make a deal with anyone.

Mol_100.speaker: Mol
Mol_100.text: Not like we have anyone in charge now. Zev's dead.

Mol_6.speaker: Mol
Mol_6.text: Look, you saved us. Not knockin' that. But after you left, Zevlor lost his nerve - gave up the fight. I won't.

Mol_106.speaker: Mol
Mol_106.text: You could have helped us. With the goblins, with the druids. But you saved your own skin.

Mol_89.speaker: Mol
Mol_89.text: I get looking out for number one - respect it, even. So if I make a deal, you can be damn sure it's what's best for me and my crew.

Mol_81.speaker: Mol
Mol_81.text: Now there's no grove, no coin, no one taking us to the city. I'm not letting my crew get eaten by shadows.

Mol_104.speaker: Mol
Mol_104.text: Maybe I'll make a deal, maybe I won't. But it'll be my choice - not the devil's and not yours.

Mol_46.speaker: Mol
Mol_46.text: Zevlor couldn't save everyone - it's my job to look after those who survived.

Mol_62.speaker: Player
Mol_62.text: My problems are a lot more pressing than yours.

Mol_80.speaker: Mol
Mol_80.text: Yeah, I bet. What kind of problems could someone like me have? You hero types are all the same.
Mol_80.context: NodeContext: She scoffs before saying "You hero types are all the same."

Mol_58.speaker: Player
Mol_58.text: I can read you like a book, Mol - call it hunter's instincts. Now tell me, what did he really offer?

Mol_9.speaker: Player
Mol_9.text: This isn't about me, it's about your soul. What did he really offer?

Mol_14.speaker: Mol
Mol_14.text: He said he could get me and my gang get to Baldur's Gate. I reckon he can do it too - don't care what your 'lore' says.

Mol_83.speaker: Player
Mol_83.text: Devils of lore don't deal in such low stakes, Mol. What'd he really offer?

Mol_114.speaker: Mol
Mol_114.text: Not that it's any of your business - I'm not poking my nose into whatever trade you made with him.

Mol_49.speaker: Player
Mol_49.text: I'm not judging, Mol. Only curious about the details.

Mol_42.speaker: Mol
Mol_42.text: Safe passage to Baldur's Gate. Safe from everyone, like Zev was supposed to do.

Mol_24.speaker: Player
Mol_24.text: Simply professional curiosity, Mol. Devils of lore don't usually deal in such low stakes.

Mol_16.speaker: Player
Mol_16.text: If Raphael offered you a good trade, you should take it.

Mol_26.speaker: Mol
Mol_26.text: No idea if it's good or not. A lot of people like to promise pretty things, but it's empty air.

Mol_4.speaker: Mol
Mol_4.text: Did he deal with you straight? Heard you two talking.

Mol_33.speaker: Player
Mol_33.text: I'm holding out. Better to make him a little desperate.

Mol_85.speaker: Mol
Mol_85.text: Yeah, that's the way to go. His lanceboard trick was meant to soften me up, but I know better.

Mol_30.speaker: Player
Mol_30.text: Take the deal if you want, kid. But a word of advice - let him get a little desperate first.

Mol_10.speaker: Player
Mol_10.text: Our kind have enough trouble with devils. You should stay away from this one.

Mol_54.speaker: Mol
Mol_54.text: If our kind looked out for one another, we wouldn't need to deal with devils.

Mol_79.speaker: Player
Mol_79.text: Raphael is a real, literal devil. You and your soul are in danger, Mol.

Mol_0.speaker: Player
Mol_0.text: Raphael is a real, literal devil. These creatures care not for you - only your soul.

Mol_35.speaker: Mol
Mol_35.text: You... you aren't joking? Huh. I kind of believe him more now than I did a minute ago.

Mol_17.speaker: Mol
Mol_17.text: Whatever. My soul's not gonna matter if we get eaten by shadow freaks.

Mol_98.speaker: Player
Mol_98.text: Do you not hear it? The power of the Nine Hells, woven in his every word? He is a devil who wishes for your very soul.

Mol_55.speaker: Player
Mol_55.text: You need to believe in yourself, Mol. Not the empty promises of a fork-tongued monster.

Mol_12.speaker: Mol
Mol_12.text: Zevlor had belief - didn't get him anywhere good. Besides, Raphael wasn't promising anything stupid.

Mol_103.speaker: Player
Mol_103.text: One should consider all options before forming a battle strategy - not just the easiest deal.

Mol_92.speaker: Mol
Mol_92.text: There aren't any other options, soldier. Raphael said he could keep me and my kids safe, and that's that.
Mol_92.context: NodeContext: solider said with maximum sarcasm

Mol_7.speaker: Player
Mol_7.text: I swore a pact with a creature like Raphael once. He's a devil, Mol. Be cautious.

Mol_11.speaker: Mol
Mol_11.text: So what if Raphael's a devil? Means he's got the power to keep his promise.

Mol_36.speaker: Mol
Mol_36.text: Also - bit rich for you to tell me who I can or can't make deals with. All things considered.
